name: bungled
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
done very badly, in a careless or stupid way: a bungled robbery Because of the bungled investigation, the accused men are free and will not be brought to trial. See
bungle
More examplesFewer examplesShe is still recovering from a bungled hip operation.He was the victim of a bungled raid on the warehouse where he worked.Counterterrorism agents questioned a man wounded in a bungled bombing attempt.
